storyInfo: In Milliarium, Ulpianus breaks into the control room in the beacon tower. Confronting the once-loyal friend who now seeks 'symbiosis' with the Seaborn, Ulpianus sentences him.

attributes.content: Ah, awake?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I've taken care of your wounds. You'll find two doses of stimulant beside you, to bring you back to your senses. Shall I administer, or would you prefer the Little Handy?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Fine, do it yourself.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: ...Very practiced motions. It seems you've recuperated well.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Now, useless as I know it is, I do need to tell you this.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You cannot keep experimenting on yourself, or you'll have to cover your eyes as well to avoid looking like you've been tortured. The mask won't be enough, at least.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: My wardrobe has nothing to do with my modifications.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: True, you've always looked that way. We all got shivers as you entered the classroom and sat your gloomy self down.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: All this time we've known each other, and you barely even show me your face.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Blandus. Given you've started cracking jokes, I take it the results are less than awful?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Now, that's tricky to say. The emotional ride I've been through felt like being seated next to Secunda as she sailed a patrol ship with both eyes shut. That is to say, utter madness.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: First of all, I noticed a baffling effect in your auto-adaptive junction...
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Your body's reaction is bizarre: when the Seaborn genes exert their abnormal dominance, your anti-Seaborn rejection response doesn't intensify. No, it actually lightens somewhat.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Which means my transformation is getting faster?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: No, quite the opposite.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: It was right as I was canceling the surgery that I observed a curious phenomenon. Once your rejection ebbed, your Seaborn genetics slowed down their influence.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: As if, to be crude, your body and the Seaborn genes had reached some sort of understanding.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: This is certainly worth further study. But for now, I need to know one thing: will this impact the Hunters in their upcoming battle?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Slaying the Firstborn will be our single most important operation since we were created.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: At this point, I will allow no freak accidents.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I've observed no negative effects so far. I'll be setting up a few more risk assessments before you head out.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: That said, if we're going to figure out what's underpinning this phenomenon, then you'd best come back alive so I have something to study at all.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I'll be honest, I'm anxious.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: We've never waged a war on this scale before. We're marching every single Abyssal Hunter, plus three whole standing Legions, off into a single trench...
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: If not with a war like this, how would we ever kill their genesezoic, their source, their 'god'?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Do you truly believe we can polish off the Seaborn just like that, once and for all?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You've worked with us for over a decade, and you still have doubts about the Hunter project?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Do you want the truth?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The truth is, I should've vetoed this project at the audit stage. A roadmap to warping evolution, predicated on sacrificing our own people's humanity.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: If not for you, I wouldn't have even entertained its feasibility, let alone poured ten years of my own blood and sweat into it.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: ...But it's a sunk cost now. The more I doubt it, the more crucial it is for me be its core member, to steer it with my own two hands.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Yet I can't shake the thought of how many 'monsters' this lab's created.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The majority of which were put down by your own two hands, Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Their deaths don't even qualify as 'sacrifices' to you, do they?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: A homeland ravaged by Seaborn will only wrest away even more Ægir lives.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: We've had this debate a thousand times. We don't need another before I leave.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Get the risk assessments going. Furthermore, suspend all ongoing Hunter modification trials.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Come again?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: With no Hunters present, it would be difficult to deal with any aberrant results.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: 'Aberrant.'
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Ulpianus, you've been the director of the Abyssal Hunter project for its entire lifespan and even you can't be fully confident in it, can you?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: That's the real reason you chose to be the first subject.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Can this campaign put the Seaborn crisis to rest? Yes or no? Even you can't be sure.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Blandus...
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: No, Ulpianus, I've spent each and every day hoping more than anyone that this will end in victory.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Maybe when you sail back, safe and sound, the project will have no more reason to exist. Think, we could even pick up where we left off on all our old research.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You barely even remember, do you? Well, I ran into our old teacher at the council. He asked about that dream of ours.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: 'The evolution of Ægir cells.'
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: It made for no particularly grand abstract, but glimpsing the whole course we've run from a microscopic cross-section? That's a beautiful pursuit, and no one can tell me otherwise.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: From our ancestors swaying their limbs in the rivers eons ago, to us here and now as we debate science and ideals, there's a flow to it all. An order of events.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: It's not too late for us to witness it, is it?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... You finally came, Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You won't even resort to flaunting your wretched sense of humor as a plea?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Hah, hah. Wretched sense of humor... Secunda would agree with you.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You know, she's really grown to resemble you over the years. I fear we'll have another you on our hands someday.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Along with the countless other yous, born by or against their will, throwing themselves into the fight against the Seaborn and perishing in combat, until the shores are soaked in Ægir's blood.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: It grieves me how she's changed. The changes in you, though, I can barely begin to comprehend.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Stop what you're doing, right now, and explain your game to me.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Blandus, Cultist of the Deep.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You're late. I've hardly anything for you to stop now.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Just a moment ago, my holochart received a signal from Nest 37. The final beacon is activated, and the Class IV weapons are warming up.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You're not putting this one down, Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: And if you hoped to learn what the Church is planning, I can't help you.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: They were tripping over themselves to protect me out of their own wishful thinking, and then one day they just went and changed their minds.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: If not for their actions, I know I might've been caught long ago. Know, though, I've never counted myself among their members. I can't even make heads or tails of their warped doctrine.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Still, if you're asking what drove me to do all this, I would love to bend your ear.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Excellent. Then I won't need to resort to violence.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Hahah! Violence.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Still taking that as your first impulse. If it weren't for the embarrassing situation you've put yourself in, I'm sure the Institute of Development Planning would love to have a chat with you.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Want to know something? It took only moments after the failed campaign for them to declare you all dead. Then, soon enough, the Institute came down to me with an invitation to restart the Hunter project.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You haven't seen the casualty report for that campaign yet, have you?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You should have a read. Abyssal Hunters, legionnaires... Their sacrifices, a tragedy, yet the ending a farce!
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Violent resistance was always a dead end. The project was dead in the water from the start.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Granted, Ægir's never used crude platitudes or propaganda to encourage such sacrifice. Every one of the project's subjects was given the freedom to make an informed decision...
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: But using the sacrifice of our citizens as a market standard, well, THAT makes the very question of free choice much ado about nothing.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Once, an Ægir's worth lay in all that they had built up and created during their life. And now? Our very lives, even our deaths, are price-tagged.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I will record your words, even though it's pointless.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Blandus, I expected your suspicion and dissent to drive you to search deeper, not reduce you to the cowardly, self-deceiving man you are now.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Whether out of passion or mourning, it's still the same brand of rhetoric spouted by every fallen claiming to foresee the fall of Ægir itself.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Assigning a character to a nation, anthropomorphizing it to critique its values... Even as a method of inflating one's ego, it's shoddy at best.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But even as you weep over the senseless sacrifice, have you never imagined how many lives your destruction of the Waterway Program will take?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Destruction?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: No, Ulpianus, I'm trying to open up a true path for us.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: What have you done?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Now now, Ulpianus, be patient. I have nothing to hide.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Blandus brushes past Ulpianus and stops before the holochart. With his back to his old friend, he passes a finger over the sea of glowing dots, and points to a flashing spot in the top-right corner.
See that? That's where the Hunters are right now.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: They activated the last beacon, and are probably caught in a deadly struggle, but they aren't in any danger... any true danger, that is.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The moment they can fight no more, that's when the weapons kick in: the Seaborn will cease fighting. Every last one thronging one of them will fall asleep.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Keep going.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: If you remember your auto-adaptive junction tech, you'll have no trouble understanding what I tell you next.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: That old surgical accident I had?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Well, you were right, it was absolutely worth the further study.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The junction brought about a homeostasis in you on the microscopic level. Your body no longer rejected the Seaborn genes, and they miraculously stopped overtaking you.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: It may have been by chance, but in no time at all, I was able to reproduce your phenomenon on the macro scale. To an extent, I could delete the hostility Seaborn bore towards humankind.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: And before Gladiia's unit left for Nest 37, during their surgery, I took the opportunity to reproduce that 'accident' of yours.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You wanted to recreate in the Hunters an 'accident' with no proven explanation, no clear effects, and not even a trace of actual, rigorous verification?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: No no no, what happened in your body has long since graduated from freak accident. While you were missing, I spent every waking moment on the research.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: ...I trusted you Hunters were still alive. Trusted you would come back, and that I could help you be free of that blasted 'fate' of yours.
attributes.name: Blandus
Ulpianus
attributes.content: But you refused to restart the Abyssal Hunter project. How did you...

attributes.name: Ulpianus
attributes.content: Were you experimenting on yourself?
attributes.joined: But you refused to restart the Abyssal Hunter project. How did you...Were you experimenting on yourself?

attributes.content: No wonder your body stinks of miasma.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Hahah, my physical condition doesn't hold a candle to yours, naturally.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I haven't much longer now, *cough* *cough*... I can practically feel each second of my life slipping away... but it was worth it. I've done all I needed to.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Tell me, Ulpianus, that the Hunters were born to be a solution. Not a tool, not a weapon, not a consumable destined to be tossed aside.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: They were.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...Good.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Then the project was a failure, but the Hunters still have a chance to fulfill their calling... yet not through senseless slaughter and sacrifice.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You'll live to show your worth. Not die to give Ægir a few more final gasps.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The Abyssal Hunters will be the start of a revised relationship between humanity and the Seaborn. If I can have them mistake humankind as their own, then maybe I can get the many to see Ægir as a neighbor.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: And you had your eyes on the Waterway Program all along.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: More precisely, the Waterway Program came to me first.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Clementia reached out to me at practically the same time as the Institute. She let me in on both the gameplan for the Waterway Program, and the research project for the Class IV weapon array.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Weapons rooted in biotech like them can impact Seaborn behavior at large. The theory grounding them has a natural affinity with the auto-adaptive junctions.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: By then, I'd already gathered the data I needed to perfect the junction tech. To the point that it was no longer limited to human subjects anymore.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: So, I made a tiny little tweak to the Class IVs. The instant they activate, we can close the book on our fight with the Seaborn.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The Abyssal Hunters, the Class IVs, it'll all transcend the boundary of species. It'll become a path. A bridge.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You can't make this up. Two centuries of constant war between Ægir and the Seaborn, and one little trick is likely all it takes to stop it.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Maybe the severity of this war was a fiction from the very beginning. Now, I mean no offense to our predecessors, but at least we still have the power to choose a different path.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Not that I'll get to see it. The rest is out of my hands... At least I was lucky enough, in the end, to see you at the Sophontheatrum.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You're the one who started the Hunter project, you know your way around self-adaptive junctions, you've been through all this. Only you, Ulpianus, only you can keep the work going.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Is that why you were so blithely waiting for my arrival? To entrust your 'work' to me before you die?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: It's my turn to invite you. Ægir and the Seaborn have a chance at achieving true symbiosis. Perhaps that's a future you wouldn't mind bearing witness to?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I refuse.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I did expect that, but still, that was a little too blunt.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Ulpianus, this is the control room where I'll die, but...
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Blandus, even if your death is certain, you must know: you have no right to go regretting anything, fighting anything.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: There was a time, not so long ago, when we ventured to make sense of the meaning of our existence by studying how our own Ægirian cells had evolved.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But you've ruined everything you had with your own hands, all for one wild flight of fancy.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The Seaborn are noxious scourge upon the ocean. There is no point in doubting that.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: They are beings full of unknowns, yet you believe in 'symbiosis' with them, as if they are your friends?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Blandus, that is the same arrogance the Ægir had in assuming victory was inevitable. No, this is that a hundred times over.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Are you even aware of what you're thinking? Can you describe this hopeful vision you see, in your fantasies of 'symbiosis'?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Are the Seaborn to be magical seafloor fairies spoken of in children's stories, or will they be our beloved household pets?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Will Gladiia debate philosophy with them? Will Skadi take teatime with them? Will Laurentina be dancing with them?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You can't paint even a single proper picture, can you?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Your own proven record as the scientist you were, thrown away. When I see you now, Blandus, I can only laugh.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I've never heard you say so much in one breath, Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: You mean to tell me you despair, yes?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The only one who ever despaired was you.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: So you have no right to go regretting anything, fighting anything. Not in front of me.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Every fallen must be sentenced, and their every corpse should be hung from the dry reefs.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...Is it even in you to sentence me?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: The campaign to slay the Firstborn was full of questionable points, and you stand as the greatest suspect. Everything you've done now puts you at odds with Ægir—
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: This nation has rejected you.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: And so I have no choice but to take on your noble work?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The man I knew would never have given this conman's rhetoric.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I'm simply stating the facts.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Then in this moment, the last I will ever spend as an Ægir, I sentence you.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Blandus says nothing back. Perhaps he's lost the energy, or given up on retorting. This dialogue of monologues has dragged on long enough, to the point it's begun to wear on him.
The golden holochart ripples before him. Too bright, he thinks—and so he closes his eyes.
From somewhere, a communication intrudes and shatters the brief silence. With it, he hears the shrill grinding of his old friend's anchor being dragged across the floor.
But only one thought makes it in time. He couldn't even give the Hunters a welcome-home hug.
